FacilityName: TWIN CITY FOODS INC.  PROSSER DIV.

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Frozen Fruit, Juice, and Vegetable Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY FOR TWIN CITY FOODS INC.  PROSSER DIV.    6-18-1999
     THIS PLANT HAS GONE THRU NUMEROUS REMODELS SINCE BUILT  PRIOR TO 1960. ALSO ADDITIONS HAVE BEEN ADDED AS REQUIRED. THE MOST RECENT ADDITION BEING AN 80,000 SQ. FT. COLD STORAGE BUILT IN 1993-1994. THIS PLANT PROCESSES POTATOES FOR APPROXIMATELY 10 MONTHS A YEAR. THE COLD STORAGE OPERATION CONTINUES YEAR ROUND. THE PLANT IS DIVIDED INTO RAW PRODUCT PROCESSING,PACKAGING,COLD STORAGE AND MACHINERY SPACES. THE REFRIGERANT USED IS ANHYDROUS AMMONIA AND APPROXIMATELY 35,000 LBS. ARE ON SITE AT ONE TIME. THE REFRIGERATION EQUIPMENT HAS BEEN EXTENSIVLY REFURBISHED WITH A MAJORITY OF THE EQUIPMENT BEING 10 YRS. OR NEWER
      THE ENGINE ROOM IS MANNED BY 5 OPERATING ENGINEERS WHO ARE MEMBERS OF THE OPERATING ENGINEERS UNION. THE ENGINEERS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR THR OPERATION  AND MAINTENANCE OF THE EQUIPMENT. PERIODICALY OUTSIDE CONTRACTORS ARE BROUGHT IN TO ASSIST WITH  OVERHAULS OR OTHER MAINTENANCE AND MODIFICATIONS.THE ENGINEERS RESPONSE EQUIPMENT CONSISTS OF  RADIOS,SCBA'S,CANNISTER MASKS, CLASS A SUITS, CONFINED SPACE KIT, AND MONITORS.TRAINING  IS ON-GOING BOTH ON AND OFFSITE. 
     THE PLANT HAS A" PROCESS SAFETY MANAGEMENT " PROGRAM WHICH CONTAINS, OPERATION PROCEEDURES , OPERATING LIMITS, PROCESS HAZARD ANALYSIS,EMERGENCY RESPONSE,ETC.. THE ABOVE IS MANDATED BY WAC 296-67-013. TWIN CITY FOODS POLICY IS "SAFETY FIRST"
     THE WORST CASE SCENARIO IS INCLUDED AS APPENDIX A, THE ALTERNATE SCENARIO IS APPENDIX B.
      IN THE EVENT OF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE THAT WE ARE UNABLE TO CONTROL OUR CONTACTS ARE PROSSER FIRE DEPT AT 911 BENTON CO.LEPC AT 911.
     SUBSEQUENT TO THE FILING OF THIS REPORT OUR MANAGER WILL MEET WITH THE PROSSER FIRE DEPT AND THE BENTON CO. LEPC TO  DEVELOP A MORE CO-ORDINATED EFFORT TOWARDS THIS PROGRAM.
